intro: Hieracium calliglaucum, commonly known as the blue-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with blue veins, giving it its common name. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
